intro: Stachystemon axillaris, commonly known as the axillary stachys, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
